aws::graph::propositions: # Pasadena Police Department Heliport Accident Information
The document recommends removing all helicopter parking spot markings.
The document recommends redesigning the heliport parking plan in accordance with AC 150-5390-2C.
AC 150-5390-2C contains paragraph 214 relevant to heliport design.
AC 150-5390-2C contains table 2-1 relevant to heliport design.
AC 150-5390-2C contains figures 2-17 and 2-18 relevant to heliport design.
Pasadena Police Department made several heliport upgrades after the accident.
Pasadena Police Department made procedural changes after the accident.
Pasadena Police Department conducted an internal review after the accident.
Pasadena Police Department reviewed their standard operating procedures manual.
Pasadena Police Department updated their standard operating procedures manual.
Pasadena Police Department installed new lighting at the heliport.
Pasadena Police Department added new markings at the heliport.
Pasadena Police Department assigned new pad assignments at the heliport.
Pasadena Police Department improved obstruction clearance at the heliport.
Pasadena Police Department removed trees at the heliport.
Pasadena Police Department removed ground obstacles at the heliport.
Pasadena Police Department conducted a procedural review.
Pasadena Police Department increased safety meetings for timely identification of issues.
Pasadena Police Department increased section meetings for timely response to issues.
Pasadena Police Department continued emphasis on factory flight training.
Pasadena Police Department continued emphasis on local flight training.
Pasadena Police Department increased ground training for Tactical Flight Officers (TFOs).
Pasadena Police Department increased flight training for Tactical Flight Officers (TFOs).
Pasadena Police Department improved section training library for personal development.
Pasadena Police Department resolved irrigation issues associated with flight line drainage.
Pasadena Police Department conducted table top exercises related to lost aircraft.
Pasadena Police Department conducted table top exercises related to aircraft accidents.
Pasadena Police Department increased ride checks with pilots to ensure compliance with established procedures.
Pasadena Police Department increased ride checks with Tactical Flight Officers (TFOs) to ensure compliance with established procedures.
The pilot held a Commercial certificate.
The pilot held a Private certificate.
The pilot had a Single-engine land airplane rating.
The pilot had a Helicopter rating.
The pilot did not have any Instrument ratings.
The pilot did not have any Instructor ratings.
The pilot had a Class 2 Medical Certification without waivers or limitations.
The pilot was an Occupational Pilot.
The pilot had an estimated 13,065 total flight hours in all aircraft.
The pilot had 725 flight hours in this make and model of aircraft.
The pilot was 40 years old.
The pilot was male.
The pilot occupied the right seat.
The pilot's restraint use status was unknown.
There was no second pilot present.
No toxicology was performed on the pilot.
The pilot's last Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) medical exam was on March 22, 2012.
The pilot's last flight review or equivalent was on May 20, 2011.

text:
# 4. Remove all helicopter parking spot markings, and redesign the heliport parking plan in accordance with AC 150-5390-2C, paragraph 214, table 2-1, and figures 2-17 and 2-18.

## OTHER INFORMATION

As a result of the accident, along with their own internal review, the Pasadena Police Department made several heliport upgrades, and procedural changes:

* Reviewed and updated their standard operating procedures manual
* Heliport upgrades included new lighting, markings, pad assignments, obstruction clearance, tree removal, ground obstacle removal, and procedural review.
* Increased safety/section meetings for timely identification and response to issues
* Continued emphasis on factory and local flight training
* Increased ground and flight training for TFO's
* Improved section training library for personal development
* Resolved irrigation issues associated with flight line drainage
* Conducted table top exercises related to lost aircraft/aircraft accident
* Increased ride checks with pilots and TFO's to insure compliance with established procedures

## Pilot Information

| | |
|-|-|
| Certificate: | Commercial; Private |
| Airplane Rating(s): | Single-engine land |
| Other Aircraft Rating(s): | Helicopter |
| Instrument Rating(s): | None |
| Instructor Rating(s): | None |
| Medical Certification: | Class 2 Without waivers/limitations |
| Occupational Pilot: | Yes |
| Flight Time: | (Estimated) 13065 hours (Total, all aircraft), 725 hours (Total, this make and model) |

| | |
|-|-|
| Age: | 40,Male |
| Seat Occupied: | Right |
| Restraint Used: | Unknown |
| Second Pilot Present: | No |
| Toxicology Performed: | No |
| Last FAA Medical Exam: | March 22, 2012 |
| Last Flight Review or Equivalent: | May 20, 2011 |

---
